SubMenus.Name: Cappuccino
SubMenus.Description: A cappuccino is an espresso-based coffee drink that originated in Italy, and is traditionally prepared with double espresso, and steamed milk foam.

SubMenus.Name: Americano
SubMenus.Description: Caffè Americano is a type of coffee prepared by diluting an espresso with hot water, giving it a similar strength to, but different flavor from traditionally brewed coffee.

SubMenus.Name: Mocha
SubMenus.Description: A caffè mocha, also called mocaccino, is a chocolate-flavored variant of a caffè latte. Other commonly used spellings are mochaccino and also mochachino.

SubMenus.Name: Green Tea
SubMenus.Description: Green tea is a type of tea that is made from Camellia sinensis leaves that have not undergone the same withering and oxidation process used to make oolong teas and black teas.

SubMenus.Name: Black Tea
SubMenus.Description: Black tea is a type of tea that is more oxidized than oolong, green, and white teas.

SubMenus.Name: Apple Juice
SubMenus.Description: Apple juice is a fruit juice made by the maceration and pressing of an apple.

SubMenus.Name: Orange Juice
SubMenus.Description: Orange juice is the liquid extract of the orange tree fruit, produced by squeezing oranges.
